3.author: HaleyxErin
3.body: Working is hell. It’s the worst way to spend time. I hate it. I want to kill myself every time I wake up and remember I have work today. I have worked a lot of job. They were all literal hell. Unless I get a degree I can’t do a job worth doing. I’m a waitress and I want most of our customers to throw themself off the roof so I never have to speak to them again. I hate them. I hate it. I hate everything. I get it life is sunshine and rainbows for you grand.  Mine is not.

3.author: sumgye
3.body:
Working is definitely not a lot of fun, but there are ways to find better jobs- in fact you just mentioned it! I think you should focus on getting a degree. Unfortunately, society right now is set up in a way that without a degree people are kinda stuck in life. It's not fair. It's not kind. But it is the world we live in. I have found that in order to effectively rebel against the system you need a platform, a voice, and money. And the best way to do this, that I have found, is to get a degree. 

I'm sorry about your life, it sounds like you really don't like it! Would you ever consider doing the brave move of trying to change it?

3.author: HaleyxErin
3.body: Yeah I’d love to change it. Too bad I can’t afford to quit my job and move or quit my job and go to school. Or marry someone willing to have sex.

3.author: sumgye
3.body: Have you considered loans? That’s what I did. I’m still in debt, but I’m going to be paying them off soon and I increase my salary from $22k to $170k in 6 years.

4.author: somuchsoup
4.body:
I don’t have my textbook handy with me. It also won’t usually become mainstream news because tabloids like buzzfeed won’t really pickup on it. When they finally come to a conclusion delineating between gen Z and Gen alpha, they’ll announce it and you’ll see gen x and y both pushed back and on sites like NYT. They did the same when they finally found the cutoff for Gen X like over two decades ago

It’s actually based on a UN report. My old prof is on the UN commission of population and development

4.author: Neato_Orpheus
4.body:
Until then your just some random guy on the internet pulling facts out of his ass bud. And still, you can source it. I doubt your text book is the only one with the info.

And how do I know you remembered it? You could be a shit student for all I know.

4.author: somuchsoup
4.body: I’m just trying to educate people, I don’t care if you believe me or not, you’re coping real hard

4.author: Neato_Orpheus
4.body:
Part of education is providing sources. Dude people claims to be all sorts of people on Reddit. I could go through you history and find you claiming to be a navy seal for all I know. (Note: I don’t care enough to check)

So if you want to tell me I’m in a different generation you are going to have to provide proof. Period. That how knowledge works bud.

People that just take a random guy on Reddit without sources are like qanon believers.

Your coping because you can’t find a source. And you know your probably wrong.

4.author: somuchsoup
4.body: It’s in the 2021 UN report, I’m technically working from home right now. But it’s there, if you’re willing to spend the time

4.author: Neato_Orpheus

If you make the claim. Provide the evidence. That’s not me being a dick.

12.author: heatmolecule
12.body: I've never said it and I would never say it to a man. But if I didn't know men think it's insulting, I would never guess because to me it sounds good. So a woman who has never seen or heard guys perspective on it might say something like that without thinking about it.

12.author: Puzzleheaded_Web8312
12.body: How does it take another perspective to see a backhanded compliment ? Is the state of human emotion that far removed from reality ? Lol imagine thinking you have a nice slim petite body and your man says “yea babe you have the perfect body, slim women just aren’t my type”. Meanwhile you’re working out thinking you have a nice slim figure. Literally no difference. You leave it at “you have a nice <insert feature>” and that’s it.

12.author: heatmolecule
12.body:
You are right, "you have a nice *whatever*" is the way to say it. But people say stupid things all the time, and if you don't know it might be hurtful to your partner, you won't think twice before saying it. 

There is a difference between a slim body in women and a big dick in men though. A slim body is universally considered attractive if you are a woman. There are men who dislike it, but they are a minority. A big dick, on the other hand, is mostly fetishized by men, not women.

But honestly, in both cases (a man complimenting your not-so-slim body and a woman complimenting your not-so-big dick), if they are sincere, you should believe them, but also definitely tell them it wasn't a good compliment for you. If they are intentionally negging you, they can fuck right off.

12.author: Puzzleheaded_Web8312
12.body: No it’s not 😂😂. Women LITERALLY make phrases and songs, and even insults that go at dick size. Let’s not act like that us something new amongst women to do. Ex.)”you just have small dick energy” Ex.) “eight inch big uhhh that’s good pipe” -song lyrics. The lust can keep going.

12.author: heatmolecule
12.body: These are just examples of unhealthy women who have found an insecurity they can exploit. They are trying to be hurtful intentionally. If an unstable woman dislikes what you've just said, you automatically have a small dick. If an unstable man disliked what you said, you are a whore or an ugly slut.

12.author: Puzzleheaded_Web8312
12.body: Ma’am, making a song that says bigger penis is better is not insecurities. It’s a woman saying what she prefers, and men hear that more than “I’d prefer a small penis”. Lol, to say it’s exploitations when millions of women agree is asinine.

12.author: heatmolecule
12.body: You should really listen to what women actually say and not something that needs to be appealing to the audience which includes insecure men, because if it isn't, it won't sell.

33.author: necrolich66
33.body:
Haven't had to use it in a while, but:

When selecting the image, two new tabs should appear. In one of those, you should see a selection of options with the image of lines and a picture of a dog.

Select the one where the picture is enveloped by the lines.

You should be able to freely move the image without much hassle.

If not, try selecting another option.
